questions.question_text:
A new CISO just started with a company and on the CISO's desk is the last complete Information Security Management audit report. The audit report is over two years old.
After reading it, what should be your first priority?
Which of the following set of processes is considered to be one of the cornerstone cycles of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 27001 standard?
When you develop your audit remediation plan what is the MOST important criteria?

choices.A: To validate the remediation process with the auditor.
choices.C: To remediate half of the findings before the next audit.
choices.B: To validate that the cost of the remediation is less than risk of the finding.
choices.D: To remediate all of the findings before the next audit.

discussion.content: You is referred as CISO. The correct answer is B.
Auditor will not be going through the remediation process, may guide though, but cares whether the risk is taken care of.
Within this context, I disagree that B is the best answer. Audit is often tied to regulatory or legal compliance, in which case cost is not the primary consideration and answer A would be better IMO.

choices.A: That all information in an organization must be protected equally.
choices.C: There is no relationship between the two.
choices.D: That the protection of some information such as National ID information is mandated by regulation and other information such as trade secrets are protected based on business need.
choices.B: The information required to be protected by regulatory mandate does not have to be identified in the organizations data classification policy.

questions.question_text: What is the relationship between information protection and regulatory compliance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the Correct Answer.
